about.title: About
about.name: Alexandra Manteiga
about.bio: Hi! I’m Alexandra, a junior at Boston College studying Computer Science and Sociology. I’m interested in building a career at the intersection of data, technology, and human-centered work, with a particular interest in communication and user-focused problem solving.

news.description: Supporting communications and marketing efforts as an intern at Autism Navigation Services.
Presented a low-fidelity chore-tracking webpage created with a team using front-end technologies including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, emphasizing clear and usable design.
Opening night of Urinetown, a student-run musical for which I managed costume design and budgeting for an 18-member cast.
Hosted Career pathways in Tech Panel with Women in Computer Science

projects.title: Autism Navigations Solutions
projects.description: This webpage highlights Autism Navigation Solutions, a new consulting business supporting parents of children with autism. I have worked closely with the founder to improve and refine the site, specifically helping develop the blog section that shares her personal stories as a parent of a child with autism and addressing reformatting and layout issues. The site is designed to be welcoming, clear, and supportive for families seeking guidance.

projects.title: Chore Tracker - Web Applications Course Project
projects.description: This webpage highlights a chore-tracking system I helped create to address accountability challenges in communal living spaces, where people are often hesitant to remind friends to stay on top of shared chores. Working with a team, we designed a low-fidelity, gamified solution to make task tracking more engaging and reduce friction around responsibility. I contributed to building the front-end interface using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

projects.title: Urinetown Musical Production
projects.description: These are photographs taken during a dress rehearsasl of Urinetown. During my time of this production, I was responsible for managing costume planning for an 18-person cast production. I independently coordinated schedules, sourced materials, and maintained a strict budget while adapting to time-sensitive challenges such as last-minute repairs and delayed supplies. Through this project, I deepend my ability to problem-solve, organize, and clearly communicate to ensure smooth and cohesive performances.

projects.title: Impacts of Physical Attractiveness
projects.description: This research paper, written for my Research Methods course, examines how both self-perceived and externally perceived physical attractiveness influence individuals’ psychology, behavior, and social outcomes. Drawing on a wide range of academic sources, the paper explores how attractiveness can create advantages such as increased confidence and social mobility, while also contributing to bias, deviance, and gender-based disadvantages.
